results.title: Macbeth by William Shakespeare: an introduction
results.creator_credit: Raoul Sobel, Insight Productions (US), BHE Education and Film Associates
results.brief_description: An abbreviated version of Macbeth is performed by a talented English company. Brief narrative bridges are used to connect the scenes, forming a comprehensible and dramatic introduction to the play. The adaption preserves the sense of madness and tragedy of the full length drama.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Raoul Sobel, Insight Productions (US), BHE Education and Film Associates

results.title: Macbeth [Animated]
results.creator_credit: et al, Natalia Orlova, Elizabeth Babakhina, Christopher Grace and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: With two US Emmy Awards, “Shakespeare - Animated tales” has won a vast new audience with its skilful, 30 minute adaptations. This can be used as a companion piece to the study of “Macbeth”, however it is far too succinct a precis to be a useful study piece for serious students of the Bard.

results.title: Macbeth (Polanski) (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Roman Polanski, Andrew Braunsberg, Caliban and Playboy
results.brief_description: Roman Polanski’s sharp and brutal version of the Shakespearean tragedy is stunning, mesmerising and brutal. A blood-stained visual palette allows Polanski to imbue the drama with his own metaphysical obsessions. The films stays true to the Shakespearean narrarive but it also stands on its own as a film about darkness and power and lust. The brutal slaying of Polanski’s wife, Sharon Tate, by Charles Manson obviously affected the direction of the film, as did the savagery in Vietnam. By forcing the viewer to confront the violence implicit in Shakespeare’s play, this version of “Macbeth” extends the dimensions of the tragedy. It is not only Macbeth and Lady Macbeth’s destruction we witness. With unrelenting and hypnotic images, Polanski makes us confront the savagery of medieval Europe. Starring Jon Finch, Francesca Annis, Martin Shaw, Nicholas Selby and John Stride.

results.title: Macbeth (Polanski)
results.creator_credit: Roman Polanski, Andrew Braunsberg, Caliban and Playboy
results.brief_description: Roman Polanski’s sharp and brutal version of the Shakespearean tragedy is stunning, mesmerising and brutal. A blood-stained visual palette allows Polanski to imbue the drama with his own metaphysical obsessions, particularly the intrusion of the irrational in human order. The film stays true to the Shakespearean narrative but it also stands on its own as a film about the darkness of power and lust. The brutal slaying of Polanski’s wife, Sharon Tate, by Charles Manson obviously affected the direction of the film, as did the savagery in Vietnam. By forcing the viewer to confront the violence implicit in Shakespeare’s play, this version of “Macbeth” extends the dimensions of the tragedy. It is not only Macbeth and Lady Macbeth’s destruction we witness. With unrelenting and hypnotic images, Polanski makes us confront the savagery of medieval Europe. Starring Jon Finch, Francesca Annis, Martin Shaw, Nicholas Selby and John Stride.

results.title: Macbeth (Perspective)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Shakespeare in Perspective Series”.
Designed to give a greater understanding and appreciation of the play by placing it in its historical and social context and by stressing its relevance for a modern day audience.

results.title: Macbeth (PC)
results.creator_credit: BBC-TV, Harper Collins and ATTICA Cybernetics
results.brief_description: Enter the world of Shakespeare’s Macbeth with this truly multimedia performance on CD-ROM. Dramatically enhance your understanding of the play as you watch, read and listen in an “Interactive theatre” on your own PC. The CD-ROM includes a complete audio performance of Macbeth, enhanced by synchronised on-screen text which is presented with hypertext study notes. In addition, 35 minutes of video from the classic BBC production of the play recreates some of the more challenging scenes. Also included is a wealth of information on the language, set-design and costumes of the play, as well as background information on the life and times of the Great Bard himself! This is an invaluable resource for students, teachers or anyone interested in exploring one of Shakespeare’s most popular plays. The package includes teacher’s notes, a copy of The Alexander Shakespeare text, and a user guide for the CD-ROM.

results.title: Macbeth
results.creator_credit: Jack Gold, Shaun Sutton, Time-Life Films and BBC
results.brief_description: A BBC television production of William Shakespeare’s “Macbeth” featuring Nicol Williamson as Macbeth, Brenda Bruce, Eileen Way, Anne Dyson as the three witches, Mark Dignam as Duncan, James Hazeldine as Malcolm and Jane Lapotaire as Lady Macbeth. One of 37 Plays by Shakespeare to be produced by the BBC. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Macbeth
results.headline_credit: France, United Kingdom and United States of America, 2015
results.brief_description: Feature film adaptation of Shakespeare’s Scottish play about General Macbeth whose ambitious wife urges him to use wicked means in order to gain power of the throne over the sitting king, Duncan.

constellations_other.name: Warwick Thornton
constellations_other.description: Brimming with Shakespearean undertones and pathos, Kaytetye filmmaker Warwick Thornton's debut feature Samson and Delilah is both a universal tale and one intrinsically tied to the experience of First Peoples in Central Australia.

constellations_other.name: The Australian industry
constellations_other.description: Though our local industry is small, our impact is huge!

results.title: Macbeth
results.creator_credit: Claude D'Anna, Henry Lange, TF1 Films productions, S F P C, Delalus and Unitel
results.brief_description: A video adaptation of Guiseppi Verdi’s operatic interpretation of Shakespeare’s Macbeth is a melodramatic libretto in four acts starring Leo Nucci as the ill-fated Macbeth, Shirley Verrett as the opportunistic Lady Macbeth and Veriano Luchetti as the voice of the nobleman Macduff and Samuel Ramey as the voice of Banco, a general of King Duncan’s Army. The orchestra, Coro del Teatro Comunale di Bologna is conducted by Riccardo Chailly. Filmed on location at the fortified castle of Godefry De Bouillon in the Ardennes, Belgium, this dark and moody version of the classic tale of greed and ambition, cuts straight to the core of the story.

results.title: MAC and me
results.creator_credit: Stewart Raffill, R.J. Louis and R J Louis Productions
results.brief_description: Eric, a wheelchair bound boy who has just moved to California begins an unusual friendship with MAC (Mysterious Alien Creature) who has accidentally landed on earth and become separated from his family. Whilst escaping from NASA MAC takes refuge in Eric’s car and accompanies the family to their new home. Eric helps MAC rejoin his family and a strong friendship is formed. Starring Jonathan Ward, Tina Casparay, Lauren Stanley and Jade Calegory.
